iati-activity.title: Frame agreement with NGO (Fida Int.)
iati-activity.description: Youth Centres in Mitrovica and Vushtrri. The project seeks to address the needs of the youth in Mitrovica and Vushtrri through empowering a local partner for effective youth work. For the past 15 years the educational opportunities for the youth of Kosovo have been very scarce; first due to Yugoslavian government regulations and then due to the prolonged political conflict. Now_ without sufficient education_ a whole generation of youth has lost their hope for future. Fida partners with the Protestant Evangelical Church to improve the situation. The project started in 2000 with one youth centre in the city of Mitrovica and soon another centre was established in Vushtrri. The youth centres offer a wide variety of activities and training for up to 2000 youth annually_ e.g. English classes_ computer training and sports events. Through organizing the activities_ the local partner gets hands-on training in youth work. Through the work done at the centres_ the skills of the local partner in youth work will increase. The centres provide the youth with meaningful leisure time activities and training in various subjects that play an important role when continuing to further education. As a consequence the overall life management skills of the youth will improve.
iati-activity.sector: Basic life skills for youth and adults

iati-activity.title: Assistance to sustainable development in Dragash
iati-activity.description: Dragash municipality which borders with Macedonia and Albania has around 40 000 inhabitants. The Sunique harrprodimi alpine range is situated in Dragash. Dragash is one of the poorest municipalities in Kosovo and suffers from out-migration. UNDP proposed for financing a project for sustainable ecological and economic development for Dragash_ including establishmen of the Sharrprodimi Stewardship Authority and a community-based development plan. The project proposal includes also creation of a Local Development Agency and 5 pilot projects. The unit for EU enlargement and Western Balkans is ready to finance the 18 months_ preparatory phase of the project with a budget of 756 000 euros. The financing of the implementation phase is also in the plans of the unit. The appraisal will be conducted in the end of the preparatory phase.

iati-activity.title: Ingo Aid to decentralisation process through ECMI
iati-activity.description: In order to support stability and sustainable development Kosovo is implementating the Ahtisaari Comprehensive Proposal for the Kosovo Status Settlement. The provisions of the proposal include multi-ethnic society_ protection and promotion of the rights of members of communities and decentralisation. According to the proposal some municipality boundaries will be changed and new municipalities established. International non-governmental organisation European Centre for Minority Issues (ECMI) requests Finnish support for a decentralisation project. The project is built for support to new and existing multi-ethnic communities during the decentralisation process. ECMI stresses the importance of participation of the local level and minorities in the decentralisation process_ and also the importance of tranparency and accountability of the decision-making in the municipalities.

iati-activity.title: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Serbia
iati-activity.description: Child Rights in Secondary Schools. The project 'Child Rights in Secondary Schools' is active response to the need of children to be protected from child abuse, neglect and violence as well as the need of educational institutions to systematically respond to the requirement to decrease the rate of violations of child rights in schools. The overall objective of the project is to build sustainable capacities in secondary schools for protection, promotion and implementation of child rights and especially the protection of child abuse, neglect and violence. The project will work on building capacities of the children to act as active agents of their teachers who will support them and build partnerships with them. It will provide number of relevant trainings for over 125 children (15-18 years old) and to 15 of their teachers from five secondary schools in Uzice. Once the trainings are implemented children and teachers will be encouraged and supported to plan school campaigns aimed at promotion of child rights.

iati-activity.title: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Serbia
iati-activity.description: Increased Responsibility in Ecology and Human Rights Teaching. The main idea of the project is to restructure and upgrade the existing courses and to develop them further according to the kindergarten and primary school curricula in Serbia. There are several groups of direct beneficiaries of the Project: teacher educators (teaching staff of the Faculty of Education in Jagodina), student-teachers (of pre-school and class teaching sections at the Faculty) and primary teachers all over Serbia. The main goal of the Project is redesigning Faculty curricula so that they support acquiring attitudes, behaviour and system of values with long-term results. The monitoring will be performed by using questionnaires for student-teachers/class teachers/English language teachers in each activity and stage of the Project. Reports will be used for comparison and final evaluation of the Project.

iati-activity.title: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Serbia
iati-activity.description: Administrative costs

iati-activity.title: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Serbia
iati-activity.description: The activities of the project " Year of Biodiversity" include: 1.Equipping the educational paths in Biosphere Reservation Golija and Special Nature Reservation "Uvac" 2. Equipping educational parks in City Kraljevo, Ivanjica and Nova Varos. 3. Training of primary school students about biodiversity and its conservation and the role of citizens in it 4. Training of primary school students about composting, 5. Organizing the eco; 6. Improving the capacities of local associations; 7.Promotion of protection and improvement of biodiversity; 8. Organization Biodiversity days to Biosphere Reserve. Projectâs target groups are: pupils from primary and secondary schools from Municipalities Ivanjica and Nova VaroÅ¡ and City Kraljevo (estimated number is around 450 pupils), youth ecologists from the region of Balkan (estimated number is 20 representatives from ecological organizations).

iati-activity.title: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Serbia
iati-activity.description: In the frame of project activities, the UCRC will design and deliver the training to the children of secondary schools. The main themes that will be covered by the training sessions will be: 1.Child rights 2.Introduction of the Protocol on prevention of child abuse, neglect and violence in context of child rights; 3.Action planning. The trainings will last for three days and they will be delivered for each of five secondary schools (15 days of trainings in total). The overall objective of the project is to build sustainable capacities in secondary schools for protection, promotion and implementation of child rights. According to this, the specific project objectives are to: educate children in area of child rights and especially in rights to protection of child abuse, neglect and violence; educate teachers in area of child rights and especially in rights to protection of child abuse, ne

iati-activity.title: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Serbia
iati-activity.description: The project "Raising awareness among primary and secondary school students on climate change and energy efficiency problems with a simultaneous capacity building of Ecological education and sustainable development centre" would be divided up into two phases. The first phase refers to the climate change phenomenon in general and has as a goal the pupils to get familiarized with the problems relating to climate change and their solving. The goal of the second phase is to point to the advantages of rational energy use, the relevance it has for our environment and to bring it in relation with the global issue, i.e. climate changes.Overall objective of the project is raising environmental awareness of pupils and citizens on climate change and energy efficiency and connecting these two problems (cause and effect).

iati-activity.title: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Serbia
iati-activity.description: The project "Say More to Everyone Who Wants to Listen" is related to the development process of solving the family violence. During this project, the adequate education will be given to the medical workers from 6 municipalities in the eastern Serbia ( Sokobanja, Boljevac, Bor, Negotin, Kladovo and Majdanpek). The basic information about the connection between the violence and health as well as the influence of the violence will be given to the 8th grade pupils in 5 elementary schools of Majdanpek Municipality. The project activities will last 11 months, from May, 2010 to April, 2011. Main project activities are: 2 trainings for the medical workers (two one-day seminars) in Sokobanja, 2 workshops in five Majdanpek primary schools, 10 workshops for the couples and check-ups for the women, victims of violence.

iati-activity.title: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Serbia
iati-activity.description: The project "Support to children with special needs in the process of inclusion" foresees a new approach to preparing the environment for the process of inclusion of children with special needs. By implementing and publishing a specially prepared picture book for children and parents, an educational workshop will be realized for parents and children and for kindergarten teachers (executives of all pre-school institutions in Belgrade). Throughout all these project activities key events will be registered in the form of a video recording, which will be used in editing the documentary treating the subject of inclusion of disabled persons in the society of Serbia. The film will be screened at the final panel discussion devoted to the topic the project deals with, which is planned on the Universal Childrenâs Day on November 20, 2010. The documentary will also be provided for broadcasting.

iati-activity.title: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Serbia
iati-activity.description: The main idea of the project is to bring a group of twenty 3rd grade high school students, from the entire territory of Serbia, to spend a week in Finland enjoying educational, cultural and leisure activities. The trip would consist of visits to various Finnish governmental institutions (such as the Ministry of Foreign Affairs and the Finnish Parliament), main cultural and tourist landmarks, as well as a visit to a Finnish high school, where they would familiarize themselves with how the educational system in Finland works, but also be able to make contacts with Finnish students of their age. The twenty one students are to be selected on the agreed selection criteria and selection procedure. On the basis of their application, the first stage of selection will be performed to narrow the group down to a number of up to twenty five students, who will then be invited for a personal interview.

iati-activity.title: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Serbia
iati-activity.description: Objective of the project "Vocational Training of young Roma people from the settlements GrmeÃ¨ and Zemun polje" is to enrol 15 unemployed Roma people from settlements GrmeÃ¨ and Zemun polje in receiving the official certificate after successfully completed vocational training on basic IT course and entrepreneurship as well as an active job search workshops during a 3-5 months course. The training practice will be organized on the Academia Educativa (3-5 months). This project will have influence on the social environment of Roma families. Project will also contribute to the improvement of the awareness of participation in educational system which is very important for future generation of Roma. Social worker will do interviews and select the right persons who are willing to enroll in project. Main criterium will be social status, poverty, willingnes to enroll in vocational training as well
